*div1 type="summary"* *p*John P. Sheldon to Austin, Detroit, Mich., October 22, 1832. Comment on Texan affairs. Delay in emigration.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Detroit, Oct. 22d. 1832.*/p* *p*Dear Sir,*/p*
*p*I beg leave to introduce to your acquaintance, *person_mentioned*Mr. Saml D. Colt Jr.*/person_mentioned*, a young gentleman of *location_mentioned*Massachusetts*/location_mentioned*. He has spent some months in this *location_mentioned*Territory*/location_mentioned*, and finding his health poor, and business here not answering his expectations, he determined on going to the delightful *location_mentioned*region */location_mentioned*which I constantly praise and often dream of—-Texas, I regret to say, that after all my exertions and arrangements I cannot get ready to remove my *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*this*date_mentioned n="Fall - 1832"> fall*/date_mentioned*. It was more difficult than I anticipated to arrange numerous accounts, which had been accumulating for more than twelve years, and to change my little property into money—and I found that I could not depart for *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, with enough in my pocket to render me independent of contingencies that were very probable. However, I do not doubt that I shall be in a condition to undertake the enterprise next season.*/p*
*p*Since my return I have conducted a *location_mentioned*weekly journal*/location_mentioned* in this *location_mentioned*city*/location_mentioned*, and have occasion [ally] published articles relative to *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, which have been well received and copied into other *location_mentioned*papers*/location_mentioned*. During the *date_mentioned n="Winter - 1832">coming winter*/date_mentioned* I propose to myself to write and publish several numbers upon the same subject.*/p*
*p*The *location_mentioned*pamphlet*/location_mentioned*, containing the interesting proceedings of the *date_mentioned n="SUmmer - 1832">past summer*/date_mentioned*, reached me some weeks since. It has been in great demand among my reading and enterprising *person_mentioned*acquaintance*/person_mentioned*, and will effect much good for *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Believe me, my dear sir, there has been no disappointment in my worldly affairs, which has caused me more regret, than my inability to carry into effect my intention to remove to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="Fall - 1832">this fall*/date_mentioned*. I feel that I shall not rest contented until I am settled for life in that genial climate and delightful *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*; and every month that I am withheld from the gratification of the predominant desire, I consider as a great and absolute loss.*/p*
*p*You will see several gentlemen in your *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*in the course of the *date_mentioned n="Winter - 1832">winter*/date_mentioned*, coming from *location_mentioned*this portion of the Union*/location_mentioned*; and I should not be suprised if the fame of *person_mentioned*Col. S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned*, and interest which *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*has excited, will soon cause you more trouble (by increasing your *person_mentioned*visitors*/person_mentioned*) than you are prepared to encounter.*/p*
*p*I should be very glad to receive letters from you often; and rest assured, that any suggestion of yours will receive that attention which my sincere desire for the welfare of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*and your intimate acquaintance with her interests, cannot fail to secure. I beg, sir, you will, at least, think me willing and able to do a little for the good of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Gen. Mason*/person_mentioned* left his *location_mentioned*home */location_mentioned*in this city a *date_mentioned n="10-19-1832">few days since*/date_mentioned*, for *location_mentioned*N. York*/location_mentioned*, whence he will go to *location_mentioned*Washington*/location_mentioned*. Before setting out for *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*he will return to this *location_mentioned*place*/location_mentioned*; and in all probability he will not see you until *date_mentioned n="02-xx-1833">February */date_mentioned*or *date_mentioned n="03-xx-1833">March nex*/date_mentioned*t.*/p*
*p*I perceive by a *location_mentioned*Nashville paper*/location_mentioned* that the *person_mentioned*Tenesee company*/person_mentioned* are about sending an *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*to *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*, in order to arrange their claims. I also learn, by a *person_mentioned*gentleman */person_mentioned*just returned to this place from *location_mentioned*N. York*/location_mentioned*, that a *person_mentioned*Mr. Jamieson*/person_mentioned* had been engaged to survey lands for the *person_mentioned*N. Y. compy*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*in the grants bordering the Trinity*/location_mentioned*, etc*/p*.
*p*If *person_mentioned*Mrs. Holly*/person_mentioned* is in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*please give her my respects and best wishes for her happiness. Remember me also to *person_mentioned*Mr. Williams*/person_mentioned* and other gentlemen who have not forgotten me,*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*John P. Sheldon */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col. S. F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
